column1: The Pit Room////I was actually hungry and I ordered brisket taco with okra as side. I specifically mentioned I want the brisket to be sliced not chopped. And guess what
column3: really really dry... I am not sure if I ordered just as default (chopped brisket in tortilla with everything on top) would it taste better or not
column5: the tortilla is just fine. There's nothing to write home about. Of course it's not a real tex-mex place and I should not critique the quality of the tortilla. However
column6: I am not a fan of their brisket either. Maybe I should have ordered beef ribs? Maybe I should come during a busier time? I don't know
column7: but I just don't feel I went to a Top 50 BBQ of Texas.
